doc.after: Li (ç¦® pinyin: lÄ­) is a classical Chinese word which finds its most extensive use in Confucian and post-Confucian Chinese philosophy. Li encompasses not a definitive object but rather a somewhat abstract idea; as such, it is translated in a number of different ways. Most often, li is described using some form of the word "rite" or "reason", "ratio" in the pure sense of Vedic á¹ta, but it has also been translated as "custom", "mores", and "rules of proper behavior", among other terms.
